title: Primary Cells   schema
description: Cells obtained from homogeneous tissue, such as a singular organ or organ sub-structure, and maintained in culture temporarily for experimental purposes

PC_Name.title: PC_Name
PC_Name.description: The name for the primary cells as chosen by LINCS
PC_Name.schema:name: PC_Name
PC_Name.schema:description: The name for the primary cells as chosen by LINCS

items.title: PC_Center_Canonical_ID
items.description: LINCS DSGC-specific canonical ID. This will be assigned by a given LINCS DSGC according to its primary cell registration scheme
items.schema:name: PC_Center_Canonical_ID
items.schema:description: LINCS DSGC-specific canonical ID. This will be assigned by a given LINCS DSGC according to its primary cell registration scheme

items.title: PC_Relevant_Citations
items.description: List of references (with PMIDs) of relevance to cell isolation, etc
items.schema:name: PC_Relevant_Citations
items.schema:description: List of references (with PMIDs) of relevance to cell isolation, etc

items.title: PC_Center_Name
items.description: LINCS center using the primary cells
items.schema:name: PC_Center_Name
items.schema:description: LINCS center using the primary cells

items.title: PC_Center_Batch_ID
items.description: LINCS center-specific cell ID; Batch specific ID
items.schema:name: PC_Center_Batch_ID
items.schema:description: LINCS center-specific cell ID; Batch specific ID

items.title: PC_Provider_Name
items.description: Name of vendor or lab (provider) that supplied the primary cell
items.schema:name: PC_Provider_Name
items.schema:description: Name of vendor or lab (provider) that supplied the primary cell

items.title: PC_Provider_Catalog_ID
items.description: ID or catalogue number or name assigned to the primary cell by the vendor or provider
items.schema:name: PC_Provider_Catalog_ID
items.schema:description: ID or catalogue number or name assigned to the primary cell by the vendor or provider

items.title: PC_Provider_Batch_ID
items.description: Vendor/Provider Batch ID number; Batch or lot number assigned to the primary cell by the vendor or provider
items.schema:name: PC_Provider_Batch_ID
items.schema:description: Vendor/Provider Batch ID number; Batch or lot number assigned to the primary cell by the vendor or provider

PC_Organism.title: PC_Organism
PC_Organism.description: Organism of origin; A controlled vocabulary describing the organism from which the primary cell was derived (e.g. Homo sapiens, Mus musculus, etc.)
PC_Organism.schema:name: PC_Organism
PC_Organism.schema:description: Organism of origin; A controlled vocabulary describing the organism from which the primary cell was derived (e.g. Homo sapiens, Mus musculus, etc.)

PC_Organ.title: PC_Organ
PC_Organ.description: Organ of origin; A controlled term describing the organ from which cell line is derived; (e.g. lung, mammary gland etc.)
PC_Organ.schema:name: PC_Organ
PC_Organ.schema:description: Organ of origin; A controlled term describing the organ from which cell line is derived; (e.g. lung, mammary gland etc.)

PC_Tissue.title: PC_Tissue
PC_Tissue.description: Organ or tissue of origin; A controlled vocabulary describing the organ or tissue from which the primary cell was derived (e.g. lung, mammary gland etc.)

branches.name: Tissues, cell types and enzyme resources

PC_Tissue.schema:name: PC_Tissue
PC_Tissue.schema:description: Organ or tissue of origin; A controlled vocabulary describing the organ or tissue from which the primary cell was derived (e.g. lung, mammary gland etc.)

PC_Cell_Type.title: PC_Cell_Type
PC_Cell_Type.description: A controlled vocabulary describing the cell type from which a primary cell was derived; e.g. epithelial like, fibroblast-like, lymphoblast like, hematopoetic, mesenchymal, neural, etc. This provides information about cell morphology. Also sometimes referred to as cell morphology
PC_Cell_Type.schema:name: PC_Cell_Type
PC_Cell_Type.schema:description: A controlled vocabulary describing the cell type from which a primary cell was derived; e.g. epithelial like, fibroblast-like, lymphoblast like, hematopoetic, mesenchymal, neural, etc. This provides information about cell morphology. Also sometimes referred to as cell morphology

PC_Cell_Type_Detail.title: PC_Cell_Type_Detail
PC_Cell_Type_Detail.description: Additional description of cell type (histology) that is not available in CL, but may be known from other sources like ATCC
PC_Cell_Type_Detail.schema:name: PC_Cell_Type_Detail
PC_Cell_Type_Detail.schema:description: Additional description of cell type (histology) that is not available in CL, but may be known from other sources like ATCC

PC_Donor_Sex.title: PC_Donor_Sex
PC_Donor_Sex.description: Describes sex of the organism from which the cell was obtained;
PC_Donor_Sex.schema:name: PC_Donor_Sex
PC_Donor_Sex.schema:description: Describes sex of the organism from which the cell was obtained;

PC_Donor_Ethnicity.title: PC_Donor_Ethnicity
PC_Donor_Ethnicity.description: For human cells, the ethnicity of the donor
PC_Donor_Ethnicity.schema:name: PC_Donor_Ethnicity
PC_Donor_Ethnicity.schema:description: For human cells, the ethnicity of the donor

PC_Donor_Health_Status.title: PC_Donor_Health_Status
PC_Donor_Health_Status.description: Controlled vocabulary describing the health status of the donor
PC_Donor_Health_Status.schema:name: PC_Donor_Health_Status
PC_Donor_Health_Status.schema:description: Controlled vocabulary describing the health status of the donor

PC_Disease.title: PC_Disease
PC_Disease.description: If the primary cell came from a particular diseased tissue, the disease should be noted in terms of a controlled vocabulary (e.g. breast cancer, colon cancer, not diseased, etc.)
PC_Disease.schema:name: PC_Disease
PC_Disease.schema:description: If the primary cell came from a particular diseased tissue, the disease should be noted in terms of a controlled vocabulary (e.g. breast cancer, colon cancer, not diseased, etc.)

PC_Disease_Detail.title: PC_Disease_Detail
PC_Disease_Detail.description: Additional description of a disease related to the primary cell that may not be available in the disease ontology above
PC_Disease_Detail.schema:name: PC_Disease_Detail
PC_Disease_Detail.schema:description: Additional description of a disease related to the primary cell that may not be available in the disease ontology above

items.title: PC_Known_Mutations
items.description: Known mutation in primary cell captured explicitly; e.g. if reference is not available

branches.source: Logical Observation Identifier Names and Codes
branches.name: Mutations

items.schema:name: PC_Known_Mutations
items.schema:description: Known mutation in primary cell captured explicitly; e.g. if reference is not available

PC_Mutation_Citations.title: PC_Mutation_Citations
PC_Mutation_Citations.description: Known mutation in primary cell from a reference; Needs to include the reference source and the reference to the specific cell
PC_Mutation_Citations.schema:name: PC_Mutation_Citations
PC_Mutation_Citations.schema:description: Known mutation in primary cell from a reference; Needs to include the reference source and the reference to the specific cell

PC_Molecular_Features.title: PC_Molecular_Features
PC_Molecular_Features.description: Relevant molecular and morphological features of the Primary Cell. (e.g. ER Status, Luminal Cells)
PC_Molecular_Features.schema:name: PC_Molecular_Features
PC_Molecular_Features.schema:description: Relevant molecular and morphological features of the Primary Cell. (e.g. ER Status, Luminal Cells)

PC_Genetic_Modification.title: PC_Genetic_Modification
PC_Genetic_Modification.description: Stable transfection, viral transduction or any other genetic modifications (de novo mutations, translocations) that were acquired. If yes, the modifications (e.g. expressing GFP-tagged protein) should be described and appropriate references provided
PC_Genetic_Modification.schema:name: PC_Genetic_Modification
PC_Genetic_Modification.schema:description: Stable transfection, viral transduction or any other genetic modifications (de novo mutations, translocations) that were acquired. If yes, the modifications (e.g. expressing GFP-tagged protein) should be described and appropriate references provided

PC_Growth_Properties.title: PC_Growth_Properties
PC_Growth_Properties.description: A controlled vocabulary describing the growth properties of the primary cell (e.g. adherent, suspension)
PC_Growth_Properties.schema:name: PC_Growth_Properties
PC_Growth_Properties.schema:description: A controlled vocabulary describing the growth properties of the primary cell (e.g. adherent, suspension)

PC_Recommended_Culture_Conditions.title: PC_Recommended_Culture_Conditions
PC_Recommended_Culture_Conditions.description: A description of the standard tissue culture conditions (media, supplements, culture dish treatment) used to maintain the primary cell. Description of culture dish treatment conditions would include information about coating of culture dish with fibronectin, collagen, etc, prior to cell plating. If special culture vessels are required to grow the cells, these should also be mentioned and details provided
PC_Recommended_Culture_Conditions.schema:name: PC_Recommended_Culture_Conditions
PC_Recommended_Culture_Conditions.schema:description: A description of the standard tissue culture conditions (media, supplements, culture dish treatment) used to maintain the primary cell. Description of culture dish treatment conditions would include information about coating of culture dish with fibronectin, collagen, etc, prior to cell plating. If special culture vessels are required to grow the cells, these should also be mentioned and details provided

PC_Related_Projects.title: PC_Related_Projects
PC_Related_Projects.description: Other projects in which the primary cells have been studied / used; A controlled vocabulary describing other large scale projects in which the cells have been used (e.g. ENCODE, TCGA, ICBP, Epigenomics, etc.)
PC_Related_Projects.schema:name: PC_Related_Projects
PC_Related_Projects.schema:description: Other projects in which the primary cells have been studied / used; A controlled vocabulary describing other large scale projects in which the cells have been used (e.g. ENCODE, TCGA, ICBP, Epigenomics, etc.)

PC_Verification_Reference_Profile.title: PC_Verification_Reference_Profile
PC_Verification_Reference_Profile.description: expected STR (reference) profile of the cell based on provider information, if available
PC_Verification_Reference_Profile.schema:name: PC_Verification_Reference_Profile
PC_Verification_Reference_Profile.schema:description: expected STR (reference) profile of the cell based on provider information, if available

PC_Cell_Markers.title: PC_Cell_Markers
PC_Cell_Markers.description: A controlled vocabulary describing the markers used to isolate / identify the cell type

branches.source: Logical Observation Identifier Names and Codes
branches.name: Cell Markers - Flow Cytometry

PC_Cell_Markers.schema:name: PC_Cell_Markers
PC_Cell_Markers.schema:description: A controlled vocabulary describing the markers used to isolate / identify the cell type

PC_Gonosome_Code.title: PC_Gonosome_Code
PC_Gonosome_Code.description: List of the sex chomosomes (gonosome) of the sample e.g. XX, XY, XXY
PC_Gonosome_Code.schema:name: PC_Gonosome_Code
PC_Gonosome_Code.schema:description: List of the sex chomosomes (gonosome) of the sample e.g. XX, XY, XXY

PC_Disease_Site_Onset.title: PC_Disease_Site_Onset
PC_Disease_Site_Onset.description: Site of disease onset in primary cell donor
PC_Disease_Site_Onset.schema:name: PC_Disease_Site_Onset
PC_Disease_Site_Onset.schema:description: Site of disease onset in primary cell donor

PC_Disease_Age_Onset.title: PC_Disease_Age_Onset
PC_Disease_Age_Onset.description: Age of disease onset in primary cell donor (in years)
PC_Disease_Age_Onset.schema:name: PC_Disease_Age_Onset
PC_Disease_Age_Onset.schema:description: Age of disease onset in primary cell donor (in years)

PC_Donor_Age_Death.title: PC_Donor_Age_Death
PC_Donor_Age_Death.description: Age of death of primary cell donor (in years)
PC_Donor_Age_Death.schema:name: PC_Donor_Age_Death
PC_Donor_Age_Death.schema:description: Age of death of primary cell donor (in years)

PC_Donor_Disease_Duration.title: PC_Donor_Disease_Duration
PC_Donor_Disease_Duration.description: Disease duration in primary cell donor; Age of Sample Acquisition - Age of Onset. (in years)
PC_Donor_Disease_Duration.schema:name: PC_Donor_Disease_Duration
PC_Donor_Disease_Duration.schema:description: Disease duration in primary cell donor; Age of Sample Acquisition - Age of Onset. (in years)

PC_Precursor_Cell_Name.title: PC_Precursor_Cell_Name
PC_Precursor_Cell_Name.description: This field specifies the name of the parent cell from which the primary cell was derived. It is left blank if this cell line was not known to be derived from another. The particular batch of that parent line that was used to generate the new line should be specified in the Production_Details (canonical) field
PC_Precursor_Cell_Name.schema:name: PC_Precursor_Cell_Name
PC_Precursor_Cell_Name.schema:description: This field specifies the name of the parent cell from which the primary cell was derived. It is left blank if this cell line was not known to be derived from another. The particular batch of that parent line that was used to generate the new line should be specified in the Production_Details (canonical) field

PC_Precursor_Cell_LINCS_ID.title: PC_Precursor_Cell_LINCS_ID
PC_Precursor_Cell_LINCS_ID.description: This field specifies the global LINCS ID of the parent cell from which the primary cell was derived. It is left blank if this cell line was not known to be derived from another. The particular batch of the parent line that was used to generate the new line should be specified in the Production Details (canonical) field
PC_Precursor_Cell_LINCS_ID.schema:name: PC_Precursor_Cell_LINCS_ID
PC_Precursor_Cell_LINCS_ID.schema:description: This field specifies the global LINCS ID of the parent cell from which the primary cell was derived. It is left blank if this cell line was not known to be derived from another. The particular batch of the parent line that was used to generate the new line should be specified in the Production Details (canonical) field

PC_Precursor_Cell_Center_Batch_ID.title: PC_Precursor_Cell_Center_Batch_ID
PC_Precursor_Cell_Center_Batch_ID.description: If this primary cell is derived from another registered cell, this field should specify the Center LINCS Batch ID of the specific batch from which it was derived
PC_Precursor_Cell_Center_Batch_ID.schema:name: PC_Precursor_Cell_Center_Batch_ID
PC_Precursor_Cell_Center_Batch_ID.schema:description: If this primary cell is derived from another registered cell, this field should specify the Center LINCS Batch ID of the specific batch from which it was derived

PC_Production_Details.title: PC_Production_Details
PC_Production_Details.description: This field specifies the procedure(s) by which the cells were derived from the parent/precursor cell, including genetic transformations and phenotypic selections. Citations / source information for constructs and citations for procedures should be included here when appropriate. If this cell line is derived from another registered cell line, this field also should specify the Center LINCS batch ID of the specific batch from which it was derived
PC_Production_Details.schema:name: PC_Production_Details
PC_Production_Details.schema:description: This field specifies the procedure(s) by which the cells were derived from the parent/precursor cell, including genetic transformations and phenotypic selections. Citations / source information for constructs and citations for procedures should be included here when appropriate. If this cell line is derived from another registered cell line, this field also should specify the Center LINCS batch ID of the specific batch from which it was derived

items.title: PC_Quality_Verification
items.description: Information pertaining to experimental verification of the primary cell identity; Batch-specific ID; STR profile
items.schema:name: PC_Quality_Verification
items.schema:description: Information pertaining to experimental verification of the primary cell identity; Batch-specific ID; STR profile

items.title: PC_Passage_Number
items.description: The number of times, if any the primary cells have been re-plated and allowed to grow back to confluency or to some maximum density if using suspension cultures
items.schema:name: PC_Passage_Number
items.schema:description: The number of times, if any the primary cells have been re-plated and allowed to grow back to confluency or to some maximum density if using suspension cultures

items.title: PC_Source_Information
items.description: This is a free-text field that provides detailed source information for this particular batch, which may include information on from whom and when the provider obtained the cells and for what purpose the cells were obtained by the end user
items.schema:name: PC_Source_Information
items.schema:description: This is a free-text field that provides detailed source information for this particular batch, which may include information on from whom and when the provider obtained the cells and for what purpose the cells were obtained by the end user

items.title: PC_Date_Received
items.description: This field specifies when this batch was obtained from the provider. Because YEAR-MO-DY is not always known, this field may only contain partial date information (e.g. YEAR-MO, YEAR only)
items.schema:name: PC_Date_Received
items.schema:description: This field specifies when this batch was obtained from the provider. Because YEAR-MO-DY is not always known, this field may only contain partial date information (e.g. YEAR-MO, YEAR only)

items.title: PC_Center_Specific_Code
items.description: LINCS center-specific coded information that can include in its format information regarding the parent / protocol used / date
items.schema:name: PC_Center_Specific_Code
items.schema:description: LINCS center-specific coded information that can include in its format information regarding the parent / protocol used / date

schema:name: Primary Cells
